business_information.name: Journey to STEAM
business_information.tagline: Empower the Next Generation of Innovators
business_information.description: Journey to STEAM is your reliable go-to provider for hands-on robotics, coding, and LEGO education programs for kids ages 5-12. Perfect for enriching camps, after-school experiences, and fostering holistic learning in schools.

mission_vision_values.purpose: We exist to empower every child to become a confident innovator, creative thinker, and empathetic leader. By blending rigorous academic standards with playful, hands-on activities, we inspire students to explore boldly and discover their potential.
mission_vision_values.mission: To deliver rigorous, cutting-edge STEAM education that empowers children to become future creators and innovators. Every lesson integrates hands-on exploration, emerging technology, and collaborative projects, giving students the thrill of discovery and the reward of deep, meaningful learning.
mission_vision_values.vision: We envision a future where every child feels empowered to dream big, tackle real-world challenges, and confidently chart their own path in an ever-evolving world.

core_values.description: Learning should always be fun and inspiring, igniting curiosity and excitement in every child.
We use the latest technology and creative ideas to help kids think differently and solve real-world problems.
Teamwork and communication are central to our approach, teaching children how to build on each other's strengths and thrive together.

team_values.description: We take pride in our work, represent the brand, and build for the long term. We hustle, lead, and care like it's ours, because it is.
We stretch ourselves, solve problems, and get better every day. We don't wait for answers, we find them. We take initiative, learn quickly, and turn every challenge into progress.
We take time to recognize progress, results, and each other. Every win matters and fuels the next one.
We spread the work, support each other, and make sure nothing falls through. We help without being asked and ask for help when we need it. We get it done, together.
We bring optimism, kindness, and good energy to everything we do. No negativity, no drama. We're a team that lifts each other up and focuses on what matters.

promise: We Listen: Every child and school district has unique needs. We collaborate closely to meet specific goals, from improving test scores to inspiring career interests.
We Keep it Fun & Rigorous: Our programs blend playful discovery with strong academic standards, ensuring deep learning and genuine enjoyment.
We Foster Relationships: We build lasting partnerships rooted in trust, quality, and continuous support, whether serving one classroom or an entire district.

founder_story.background: Dr. Arielle Hammond is a local mom and longtime school principal with over a decade of experience leading schools, coaching teachers, and designing curriculum.
founder_story.motivation: As a mother, Dr. Arielle wanted her children to fall in love with STEM from the very beginning. She and her husband dreamed that their children would one day reach for the stars (literally - becoming astronauts has always been part of the family plan). When she searched for programs that were hands-on, rigorous, joyful, and truly designed to unlock that kind of potential, nothing measured up. So she created the program she wished existed.
founder_story.philosophy: Every lesson had to be something she'd be proud to give her own children. That blend—the precision of an educator and the heart of a parent—is what shapes Journey to STEAM today.
founder_story.hiring_standards: We hire fewer than 10 percent of applicants, bringing on experienced educators and STEM professionals who see brilliance in every child. Each instructor receives hands-on training and coaching from Dr. Arielle to ensure that every classroom is a safe, joyful, structured, and truly enriching environment.

parents.description: Parents of children ages 5-12 looking for high-quality STEM enrichment programs

program_types.location: Elementary and middle schools, community centers
benefits: Fun and engaging during school breaks

program_types.description: Customized STEAM programs for schools and districts

program_pathways.pathway_name: Invent, Engineer, and Program: A Future Engineer's Journey
program_pathways.description: This dynamic STEAM pathway introduces participants to coding, robotics, game design, and engineering. With every project, they explore new possibilities while building a strong foundation for creative and technical thinking.

program_pathways.pathway_name: Build, Program, and Innovate with LEGO: A Future Robotics Engineer's Journey
program_pathways.description: Young engineers explore robotics with LEGO Spike, designing and programming functional robots to solve creative challenges.

program_pathways.pathway_name: Design, Build, and Invent with LEGO: A Future Mechanical Engineer's Journey
program_pathways.description: Hands-on LEGO projects introduce mechanical engineering through play, invention, and real-world problem solving.

program_pathways.pathway_name: Invent, Code, and Play: A Future Game Developer's Journey
program_pathways.description: Combining physical and digital game design, students develop storytelling, logic, and user-centered design through creative projects.

program_pathways.pathway_name: Invent, Engineer, and Program: A Future Engineer's Journey (Camp Edition)
program_pathways.description: Camp-based STEAM experiences that combine hands-on learning, creativity, and technical skills across engineering, coding, and design.

program_pathways.pathway_name: Imagine, Code, and Create: A Future Software Developer's Journey
program_pathways.description: Young coders bring animations, games, and stories to life through Scratch, building logic, creativity, and coding skills.

E.name: Engineering
E.description: Design thinking, problem-solving, and building solutions

A.name: Arts
A.description: Creative expression and design integrated with STEM

pricing_policies.pricing_policy: All Journey to STEAM programs are a flat rate. We do not prorate for late registration, missed classes, or school closures, including weather-related disruptions.
pricing_policies.payment_note: This policy allows us to deliver the highest quality experience to every student, every time.

scholarships.description: We offer limited scholarships to help ensure all children can participate in our programs. As a small business, we're committed to serving our community.
scholarships.eligibility: Based on eligibility and program availability
scholarships.limitations: We do not offer full scholarships, and scholarships are honored as they are available. They are not guaranteed for every program.
scholarships.contact: To inquire, please contact us directly by emailing getintouch@journeytosteam.com

gift_cards.description: Give the gift of STEM! Purchase a gift card for a child to join our programs.

faqs.question: How do I register my child for a program?
faqs.answer: Registration varies between programs. Mostly, registration will take place directly through our website. Some schools prefer to manage registration through their school or school district. Some community organizations also prefer direct registration through their websites. Details for registration for each of our programs and camps are available on our website and social media.

faqs.question: How does Journey to STEAM ensure my child's safety?
faqs.answer: Your child's safety is at the heart of everything we do. We follow rigorous safety protocols and hire only the most qualified instructors—less than 10% of applicants make it through our selective process. Every instructor passes a comprehensive background check and receives ongoing coaching and support to create a secure, encouraging environment where kids can thrive. Our team is trained not just to teach, but to care deeply and lead with integrity.

faqs.question: What age groups do you serve?
faqs.answer: Our programs are designed for elementary and middle-school students (grades K-8). However, we can adapt our offerings for different age groups based on your organization's requirements.

faqs.question: Where are programs held?
faqs.answer: Our programs are conveniently hosted at elementary schools across Clackamas, Multnomah, and Washington counties in Oregon, as well as in Clark County, Washington. Our camps are located in elementary and middle schools and community centers.

faqs.question: How long are the programs?
faqs.answer: Our programs consist of 8 sessions, meeting once a week. Each session lasts 1 hour. Camp sessions last 3-4 hours and meet for one week.

faqs.question: Do you offer scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer limited scholarships to help ensure all children can participate in our programs. As a small business, we're committed to serving our community, which is why we provide these scholarships based on eligibility and program availability. Please note that we do not offer full scholarships, and scholarships are honored as they are available. They are not guaranteed for every program. To inquire, please contact us directly by emailing: getintouch@journeytosteam.com.

faqs.question: What happens if there's inclement weather?
faqs.answer: We do not reschedule or offer make-up days for inclement weather. This approach keeps our programs running smoothly and ensures our resources are focused on delivering exceptional experiences, not managing unpredictable variables. Families appreciate this clarity, and it helps us keep quality high for everyone.

faqs.question: Do you prorate for late registration or missed classes?
faqs.answer: No. To ensure fairness and program consistency, all Journey to STEAM programs are a flat rate. We do not prorate for late registration, missed classes, or school closures, including weather-related disruptions. This policy allows us to deliver the highest quality experience to every student, every time.

faqs.question: What is your EIN for tax purposes?
faqs.answer: Journey to STEAM's Employee Identification Number, EIN is: 83-2697968. You may need this for your taxes. We do not provide tax advice. Please see a tax consultant for more information.

faqs.question: How often do you add new programs?
faqs.answer: We update our program offerings weekly, so be sure to check back often on our website and social media platforms for the latest and greatest learning adventures!

faqs.question: How can I stay updated on new programs?
faqs.answer: Stay connected with Journey to STEAM through our website and our social media platforms—Facebook and Instagram. We regularly update our platforms with the latest information and offerings.

parent_champion_program.name: Parent Champion Program
parent_champion_program.description: We partner with amazing parents to launch high-quality, hands-on STEAM programs at select schools.
how_it_works: Fill out the form to become a Parent Champion
Get our step-by-step Toolkit + email templates
We work with you to pitch your school
When your school schedules a program and it hits minimum enrollment, you earn rewards and your child gets bragging rights
rewards: Your child participates in one full term for FREE (at least a $275 value!)
STEAM swag for your child's class/teacher
Your name featured as a Champion in our parent newsletter
ideal_schools: Have strong family engagement and enrichment programs
Have supportive administration or active parent involvement
Are communities that invest in high-quality after-school opportunities
parent_champion_program.support_provided: We provide email templates to help you advocate, and we'll handle the heavy lifting once you make the connection. We can also help schedule a presentation if needed.
parent_champion_program.multiple_referrals: Yes, you can refer more than one school. If you refer multiple schools, you will be entered into a free program drawing.

careers.why_join: At Journey to STEAM, we believe in the power of education to ignite curiosity and unlock the potential of every child. As a member of our team, you'll have the opportunity to make a real impact, fostering creativity, critical thinking, and a love for learning.

Your commitment to making a positive impact on young learners

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Is this just playing with LEGOs?
common_objections_and_responses.response: No! While we use LEGO as an engaging tool, our programs teach rigorous academic content including coding, robotics, engineering principles, and problem-solving. LEGO is the vehicle for deep learning, not just play.

Our programs integrate Arts (the A in STEAM) and focus on creativity, design, and storytelling alongside technical skills. We've seen many students who thought they 'weren't into tech' discover new passions through our hands-on, creative approach.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Is this too advanced for my kindergartener/too basic for my 8th grader?
common_objections_and_responses.response: We offer age-appropriate pathways for grades K-8. Programs scale in complexity, from Intro to Scratch Jr for younger learners to advanced robotics challenges for older students. We can also adapt offerings based on specific needs.

At $275+ for an 8-week program (about $34/session), you're getting instruction from highly qualified educators (top 10% of applicants), LEGO Education materials, a rigorous curriculum designed by a former principal, and college/career-ready skills. We also offer limited scholarships for families who need financial assistance.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: What if my child misses a session?
common_objections_and_responses.response: We maintain a flat-rate policy to ensure program consistency and quality for all students. We do not prorate for missed sessions, which allows us to deliver the highest quality experience every time. This policy is clearly communicated upfront.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Can my child just attend a few sessions?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Our programs are designed as complete 8-week learning journeys where skills build progressively. Students get the most value from attending the full program, which is why we don't offer partial enrollment.

escalation_triggers: Parent wants to enroll immediately (connect to registration process)
Questions about special needs accommodations (connect to Dr. Arielle or team)
Complaints or refund requests (escalate to management)
Complex scheduling conflicts (connect to program coordinator)
School partnership inquiries (connect to business development)
Questions requiring medical advice (redirect to pediatrician)
Requests outside knowledge base (offer to connect with team member)
chatbot_guardrails: NEVER confirm enrollment or take payment information - always direct to registration page or team
NEVER provide medical advice - redirect to 'Please consult your pediatrician'
If asked about topics outside knowledge base, offer to connect with a team member
Always maintain warm, friendly, professional tone (helpful school administrator)
Keep responses concise (2-3 sentences max unless explaining programs)
Naturally capture lead information (name, email, phone) during conversation
When escalation is needed, use phrase: 'Let me connect you with our team who can help with that specifically'

Follow us on Facebook and Instagram for updates
Check our website weekly for new program offerings
Become a Parent Champion and bring Journey to STEAM to your school
Schedule a call to explore school partnerships
Apply for a scholarship if financial assistance is needed
Visit our careers page to join our team
quick_facts: Founded in 2023 by Dr. Arielle Hammond, former K-5 principal
Operates in Portland Metro area (Oregon and Washington)
Uses LEGO Education materials and curriculum
All instructors background checked and trained
No prorating for missed classes or weather
Programs updated weekly - check website often
